content: Just a thought, how about a boot camp for soon to be husbands? I know I coulda used it, it took a lot of fumbles before I could get close to being right! I'm still trying to get it right. title: Boot camp for soon to be husbands!

content: After I saw the interview with the wife of Captain Chesley “Sully” Sullenberger's, (Hudson River Crash Captain). Where she said, "I knew it would be OK because Sully was the pilot. You only know his as the pilot who landed the plane safely. I know him as they man who brings a cup of tea every morning." To me that was one of the greatest "love stories" I have ever heard. Since, that day I have brought my wife breakfast in bed in bed everyday, except when I have taken her out for breakfast. We've been married for 48 years. I think that we had one of the greatest marriages ever. But, after that day, I know we really do have the greatest marriage ever. Here's a quote from many years ago. "If you want to be the king of the castle, treat the lady of the castle like a queen." It really changed something in me. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans
